intro: Johrenia engleri, commonly known as the Engler's johrenia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Africa, particularly Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
